sub_topic: The construction of the Heighway dragon curve.
message_1: What is the length of the Heighway dragon curve after 10 iterations if the initial line segment has a length of 1 unit?
message_2:
The length of the Heighway dragon curve after n iterations can be calculated using the formula:

Length = Initial length * (2^(n/2))

In this case, the initial line segment has a length of 1 unit, and we want to find the length after 10 iterations. So, we can plug in the values into the formula:

Length = 1 * (2^(10/2))

Length = 1 * (2^5)

Length = 1 * 32

Length = 32 units

So, the length of the Heighway dragon curve after 10 iterations is 32 units.
